    • Method Detail

      • getSrc

        public int getSrc()
        Gets selected source node that the player needs to guess the shortest distance between and returns it.
        Specified by:
        getSrc in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        The integer representing the source node

      • getDest

        public int getDest()
        Gets selected destination node that the player needs to guess the shortest distance between and returns it.
        Specified by:
        getDest in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        The integer representing the destination node

      • getShortestPath

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getShortestPath()
        Gets the shortest path between the selected source and destination nodes of the graph.

        The method uses the getShortestPath method of the Graph object to calculate the shortest path and stores it in the shortestPath variable of the Game object before returning it.

        Specified by:
        getShortestPath in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        List of shortest path between src and dest nodes

      • getAllShortestPaths

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getAllShortestPaths()
        Gets all paths between source and destination nodes of the graph.

        The method uses the getPaths method of the Graph object to calculate all paths and stores them in the allShortestPaths instance variable of the Game object.

        The paths are then returned as a list of lists of integers.
        Specified by:
        getAllShortestPaths in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        Nested list of integers representing all paths between the source and destination nodes of the graph.

      • getResult

        public int getResult()
        Gets the shortest distance between the two selected nodes of the graph.

        The method checks if the shortest path has been calculated and stored in the shortestPath instance variable.

        If this is the case, it calculates the shortesd distance between the nodes using the getShortestDistance method of the Graph object and stores it in the result instance variable and is returned.

        If the shortest path hasn't been calculated, the method returns 0.
        Specified by:
        getResult in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        Integer representing the shortest distance between the source and destination of the graph.

      • importGraph

        public void importGraph()
        Imports the graph from a file with a given filename using the getGraph method of the Graph object.

        The method sets the filename where the graph is stored and calls the getGraph method of the Graph object, passing in the filename.

        The imported graph is then stored in the graph instance variable of the Game object.
        Specified by:
        importGraph in interface GameInterface

      • getAdjMatrix

        public int[][] getAdjMatrix()
        Gets adjacency matrix of the graph.

        The method calls the getAdjMatrix method of the Graph object and stores the adjacency matrix of nodes and weights in the adjMatrix instance variable of the Game object.

        The method then returns the adjacency matrix.
        Specified by:
        getAdjMatrix in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        Two-Dimensional integer array representing the adjacency matrix of the graph.

      • printGraph

        public void printGraph()
        Prints the full graph to the terminal with both nodes displayed first, then the weight.

        The method uses a nested for loop to iterate through all the nodes of the graph and print all the weights between them.

        It checks if there is a valid weight between the two nodes and prints the source node, destination node, and the weight between them.

        e.g. '35 28 weight: 7'

        Specified by:
        printGraph in interface GameInterface

      • getScore

        public int getScore​(Player player,
                    java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> allShortestPaths,
                    int guessDistance)
        Calculates the player's final score based on their guess weight, the actual weight, and the number of possible paths between the source and destination nodes.

        The maximum possible score is limited by the difficulty of the game.

        If the difference between the player's guess and the actual result is too great, then the player gets a score of zero.

        Otherwise, the player's final score is calculated by using the difficulty modifiers and the error.

        The player's score is then saved to the players file which is used for the leaderboard.

        Specified by:
        getScore in interface GameInterface
        Parameters:
        player - the player for whom the score is being calculated
        allShortestPaths - the list of all paths between source and destination node
        guessDistance - the distance guessed by the player
        Returns:
        The player's final score as an Integer

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method of the game. It prompts the user for their username and the choice to either play the game or view the leaderboard. If the user chooses to play the game, they are prompted to select two nodes or let the nodes be randomly selected for them. The user is then prompted by the game to guess the distance between the two selected nodes.

        The method imports the graph, prints it, and calculates the shortest path and all paths between the two nodes.

        The user's guess is compared to the actual distance and a score is calculated and displayed to the user.

        If the user instead selects to view the leaderboard, it is printed to the terminal.
